title: Why does Poppy's E take precedence over my E (as Hecarim)?
body:
I mean we both E'd each other and hers knocks me back.

Does anyone know the mechanics on this?

replies.body: Probably because the engage range for poppy's E is larger than Hec's; so she got the jump on you.

> [{quoted}](name=Roguestoney,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=3eMnGx4G,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-12-09T01:00:02.547+0000)
>
> Probably because the engage range for poppy's E is larger than Hec's; so she got the jump on you.

So you think it depends on a half way point, where if my E is at a point where it's going to have a lesser impact - it takes precendence, sort of a counter mechanic where if she is early on her E it doesnt take precedence?

My E was in animation and had begun the sound effect and knockback and it did the on-hit and her E took precedence. Like I E'd and right clicked and was 3/4 of the way through and then she E'd - but like is it because hers is on target and mine isn't or something? Because the animation of knocking her back had applied before she was close - it's just weird that her knockback cancels mine so I was wondering what the mechanic was, because she had the E applied to her and her E is really the same, where each applies a knockback but mine was in animation and application before hers (he was doing the charge then she E'd - so does E'ing later counteract or something?).
Yeah I think it definitely has to do with the animation timing. Hecarim's E animation is just real long so it takes forever for the actual knockback to happen.

> [{quoted}](name=Nya Hop,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=3eMnGx4G,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2015-12-09T01:27:37.504+0000)
>
> So 

I'm going to take a guess and say if she engages her E before your animation gets past a certain point that her E takes Precedence over Hec's. 

This is just how I feel I could be wayyyyy off the mark though.

Basically, unless your ability is "unstoppable" (think like Malphite ult, Vi ult), Poppy will be able to block you with her W. 

Another way to think about it is that her W will block anything that would normally be interrupted by knockbacks/knockups. For example, if Tristana tries to jump away from Poppy, her W would block it, just like Thresh's Flay would block Tristana's jump. However, it still won't block blinks like Ezreal's E.

Does that make sense?

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Koalifier,realm=NA,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=3eMnGx4G,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-12-09T00:59:18.637+0000)
>
> Basically, unless your ability is "unstoppable" (think like Malphite ult, Vi ult), Poppy will be able to block you with her W. 
> 
> Another way to think about it is that her W will block anything that would normally be interrupted by knockbacks/knockups. For example, if Tristana tries to jump away from Poppy, her W would block it, just like Thresh's Flay would block Tristana's jump. However, it still won't block blinks like Ezreal's E.
> 
> Does that make sense?

No I mean her E, heroic Charge. I devastating charged her and it was animating and she heroic charged me and she knocked me back instead of the other way around. Her W was on cooldown (The aoe that stops dashes) we just both charged each other, her with her dash knockback and the tiny little Yorlde outdoes my giant pony knockback on my E as I dash in and knock them back and apply damage.

Ohhhhhh that makes a lot more sense. Yeah in that scenario her E should "win" over your E. Basically, her E knocks you back before you can knock her back, I think due to the long animation/knockback timing of Hec's E. As far as I know, Hec E basically loses most knockback fights with dashes (like vs. Sejuani, Vi, now Poppy). It just feels weird because Poppy's E is targeted as opposed to a skillshot.

My guess is that this is working as intended, and just an unfortunate result for Hecarim :(

i think he means they both dashed at eachother, and her dash knocked him back ignoring his dash.

so unless she had W active at the time (which is entirely possible) its just the E he means.. i think.

> [{quoted}](name=Lord Sesshomaru,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=3eMnGx4G,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-12-09T01:03:07.838+0000)
>
> i think he means they both dashed at eachother, and her dash knocked him back ignoring his dash.
> 
> so unless she had W active at the time (which is entirely possible) its just the E he means.. i think.

Yeah lol why does her E outdo my E. It wasn't her W, her W was on cooldown, we just both charged each other and I was dashing at her with E and it began animating and she heroic charged me and she knocked me back instead of the other way around.

> [{quoted}](name=Lord Sesshomaru,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=3eMnGx4G,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-12-09T01:03:07.838+0000)
>
> i think he means they both dashed at eachother, and her dash knocked him back ignoring his dash.
> 
> so unless she had W active at the time (which is entirely possible) its just the E he means.. i think.

Fair enough. Probably W was active. That's what i would do.

Ah ok. Thanks Koalaifier. I thought she charged forwards with a small circle around her that was the connect zone and Hecarim having a bigger model would have a bigger area and win it hands down but if you think it's about cast animations I might have to be more careful when taking on Poppy.

She's pretty quick lol.
Is Hec's E a click on ability? If not (I've never played him) I suspect the guaranteed aspect of an on click ability take precedence over the other. At least in my experience.

It activates a mode then he moves faster then you have you right click them.

The weird thing is though, if you are point blank during an auto-fest with someone and you hit E it knocks them back like instantly because it's an attack reset so you can use it to interrupt them for whatever reason. (Attacking the target applies his E too so if you have attack clicked them then hit E it knocks them back like straight away which can be useful but you miss out on the skills damage boost for how far you travelled during it being active).

It probably depends on who uses theirs first. What I mean is, either the first to use it takes precedence *or* the last to use it takes precedence. Might be worth testing in a custom.

How would you even have both apply? It's not really practical.

> [{quoted}](name=HeartVine,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=3eMnGx4G,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-12-09T00:58:37.977+0000)
>
> It probably depends on who uses theirs first. What I mean is, either the first to use it takes precedence *or* the last to use it takes precedence. Might be worth testing in a custom.
> 
> How would you even have both apply? It's not really practical.

Lol. I'd just like to know the mechanics hahahaha. I think the other person was right though, if my knockback is going to knock her back further and she casts hers a little late, her's over-rides because it's going to knock me back a shorter distance so it's a sort of "first in worst dressed" mechanic. If two blitz's grab each other they do whirly whirlys and meet in the middle and in other patches they swap places.

Why does Sion's Ult go through Azir's ult? 

just one of life's mysteries
